message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this unique opportunity to acquire a valuable product. I believe you'll find it a worthwhile investment. I'm willing to sell it to you for $900000.
I'm interested in the product, but I think $900000 is a bit steep. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $850000 for the product. Can you consider this price?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob, but I was thinking more along the lines of $875000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you. What are your thoughts?
I understand your perspective, Alice, but $875000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to compromise and offer $825000 for the product. Can you consider this price?
I can see you're serious about acquiring the product, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $850000, but I'm not going any lower than that. This is my final offer on this price point.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $850000, Alice, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to go up to $825000, but no higher. Can you consider this price?

I'm starting to think we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. I'll sell the product to you for $875000, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I understand your position, Alice, but $875000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $850000, but I'm not willing to go any higher. Can you reconsider and meet me at this price?

I've made a significant concession, Bob, and I'm not willing to go any lower than $875000. However, I'm willing to give you a small discount, just for you. I'll sell the product to you for $862500. This is my final offer.

I appreciate your willingness to give me a discount, Alice, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $800000 and $862500. Can you consider selling the product to me for $831250?
